2.comment: Caleb Hanie (3-4, 36) no chance.    There are no stats worth noting for the Bears because they couldn't move the chains at all. In fact, they achieved their third first down of the contest in the final second of the third quarter. passing_interceptions.sentence: Fortunately for them, they are deep at receiver and have Hanie, but for some reason, Jay Cutler's replacement tried too many risky passes and was consequently picked off 3 times.

4.comment: Caleb Hanie at quarterback. The Raiders have been nicked up at the skill positions all season and were without wide receivers Denarius Moore and Jacoby Ford and stud running back Darren McFadden. Fortunately for them, they are deep at receiver and have Hanie, but for some reason, Jay Cutler's replacement tried too many risky passes and was consequently picked off 3 times. He was absolutely horrible in the first half.)    Both teams entered this game limited offensively. The Bears are entering the stretch run with Caleb Hanie at quarterback. 6.comment: Caleb Hanie didn't turn the ball over, though he came very close when Chris Harris dropped a routine interception.Hanie didn't turn the ball over, though he came very close when Chris Harris dropped a routine interception. Hanie went 12-of-19 for 115 yards, but took 4 sacks because Mike Martz had him take too many 7.step drops yet again.    Only 4 Bears caught passes:

7.comment: Caleb Hanie, the game still sucked. Compared to Hanie, Jackson looked like the second coming of Johnny Unitas. Jackson, who went 19-of-31 for 227 yards and a touchdown, did a good job of converting third downs despite not having Sidney Rice. He caught fire in the second half, finishing 15-of-19 for 176 yards after the break. Jackson's top receiver was Hanie, the game still sucked.
